page.title: 04THE WATER PROBLEM
page.content: With a population of over 75,000 in the winter and considerably more in the summer, consumption of water within the Island continues to increase. Hotels have been upgraded to include bathrooms in each room and living standards demand a much higher use of water. Water is supplied within the Island by a variety of means. Many people have their own supply from boreholes and wells. Water from the mains comes from a number of reservoirs and, during very dry years, from a desalination plant. It may seem that Jersey does not have a water problem and during many years when rainfall is high and summers cool there is none..... but.... when summers are hot and dry there is a short fall in supply.
